intro: Asyneuma macrodon, commonly known as the large-fruited false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two parts when mature, each containing a single seed. Asyneuma macrodon is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
